alert.note: Alert for Madison; Onondaga; Southern Cayuga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 4:05AM EST until January 18 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Lake effect snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, highest over southern Cayuga and southern Onondaga Counties. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will cause blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Onondaga, Madison and Southern Cayuga counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light lake effect snow showers will continue through the early morning hours, mostly producing light accumulations of less than an inch, including in the Syracuse metro area. A band of locally moderate snow may develop closer to daybreak over southern Cayuga County into Southern Onondaga County, with higher snowfall amounts.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for New York can be found at 511ny.org. Or, dial 5 1 1 from within the state.
